item.title: Using Wikilinks and Git/Obsidian Callouts in Quarto Markdown
item.description: About Callouts Disclaimer: Previous version of this post was originally published as a public gist Callouts are a great way to highlight important details in your text by adding boxes with icons. Many flavours of markdown support them (but might use different syntax). Quarto supports 5 callout types: note warning important tip caution. Each type has a different color and icon. You can see examples in the Quarto documentation. The Problem To use callouts in Quarto markdown (qmd) files, you need to use Pandoc’s div syntax:
